name: Sigiriya Rock Fortress
description: Ancient rock citadel with frescoes and sweeping views. Sigiriya, also known as the Lion Rock, is a UNESCO World Heritage site and one of Sri Lanka's most iconic attractions.

name: Dambulla Cave Temple
description: Ancient Buddhist cave temple with stunning murals and statues. The Golden Temple of Dambulla is a UNESCO World Heritage site and features over 150 Buddha statues.

name: Temple of the Sacred Tooth Relic
description: Sacred Buddhist temple housing Buddha's tooth relic. Located in the royal palace complex of the former Kingdom of Kandy, this temple is one of Buddhism's most sacred pilgrimage sites.

name: Unawatuna Beach
description: Golden sand beach with calm waters and great snorkeling. This crescent-shaped beach is one of Sri Lanka's most popular coastal destinations.

name: Yala National Park
description: Wildlife sanctuary famous for leopards and elephants. Yala has one of the highest leopard densities in the world, making it a premier safari destination.

name: Horton Plains National Park
description: Plateau with biodiversity and breathtaking landscapes. Home to World's End, a stunning cliff with a sheer drop of about 4,000 feet.

name: Ella Rock
description: Hiking destination with spectacular mountain views. A challenging but rewarding hike through tea plantations and forests to reach the summit.

name: Galle Fort
description: Colonial-era fortress with Dutch and Portuguese influences. This UNESCO World Heritage site is a living monument with well-preserved architecture.

name: Nine Arch Bridge
description: Colonial-era railway bridge surrounded by tea plantations. This iconic bridge is one of Sri Lanka's most photographed locations.

name: Pinnawala Elephant Orphanage
description: Sanctuary for orphaned elephants to observe and interact. Watch elephants bathing in the river during designated times.
